page.title: 10Names in the Chinnor area
page.content: Domesday Book mentions 'Chenore', one meaning given being 'village over the hill'. Icknield Way or Ridgeway, is a prehistoric route following the contours of the Chilterns.The name is thought to come from the Iceni, a tribe of East Anglia. There is another Icknield Way running through Chinnor which is a parallel route at a lower level. Mill Lane School lies on this road; here called Mill Lane because of the windmill that was once there. Domesday alludes to 'Sidreham'. The name is thought to mean 'by the wide river meadow'. Emmington was derived from 'Amyngton' or 'Eama's Farm'- Saxon. In the recent past, an Emmington shepherd died whose name was Joe Malin-there is still a 'Malin Cottage' in Emmington.(cont)
